intro: Prunella hastifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf selfheal, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy on the underside, and it produces small, blue to violet flowers in whorls along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Prunella hastifolia is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
